basics.name: Tyler Van Schaick
basics.label: Front-end Developer
basics.summary: Richard hails from Tulsa. He has earned degrees from the University of Oklahoma and Stanford. (Go Sooners and Cardinal!) Before starting Pied Piper, he worked for Hooli as a part time software developer. While his work focuses on applied information theory, mostly optimizing lossless compression schema of both the length-limited and adaptive variants, his non-work interests range widely, everything from quantum computing to chaos theory. He could tell you about it, but THAT would NOT be a “length-limited” conversation!

highlights: Constructed the HTML, CSS and scripts for client websites on a regular basis.
Built customized email templates using Foundation (Zurb) Emails 2.0 and integrated functionalities afforded by email marketing services such as MailChimp and HubSpot.
Maintained and upgraded client's WordPress installation and plugins, debugged and repaired any compatibility issues arising from the WP core, theme and plugin updates.
Authored documentation for custom functionalities that were built into client websites.
Set up Git version control for client website's to improve the development cycle and documentation for each site.

Provided knowledge in Responsive Web Design (RWD) to ensure mobile-responsive capabilities for new web projects. Converted an existing client website into a mobile-responsive one using RWD techniques.
Operated on various client websites to make HTML and CSS updates.
Designed graphics with Photoshop for online advertisements and email marketing.
Updated the promotions and general information provided on various car dealership websites.

education.area: Bachelor of Arts in Digital Media
